meanings.definition: An ambush or trap set for an enemy.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers set up ambuscades to surprise the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The ambuscades were carefully hidden in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The ambuscades made the enemy walk right into their trap.
meanings.sent4: The ambuscades were like invisible snares waiting to be sprung.
meanings.sent5: The clever use of ambuscades won the battle for the army.

meanings.definition: To lie in ambush or wait in hiding to attack.
meanings.sent1: The hunters ambuscades near the watering hole for hours.
meanings.sent2: The bandits ambuscades behind the rocks, waiting for the stagecoach.
meanings.sent3: The cat ambuscades the toy mouse, thinking it's real.
meanings.sent4: The spy ambuscades in the shadows, gathering valuable information.
meanings.sent5: The ninja ambuscades silently, ready to strike at any moment.
